solution.text:
volume of air inside the box = volume of the box - volume of the 2 cylinders
volume of the box = volume of a cuboid + volume of the half cylinder
Volume of the cuboid =\(l\times b \times h\), where \(l\) is length, \(b\) is width and \(h\) is height
\(\Rightarrow \) Volume of the cuboid\(=_{{4*j}}_ \times _{{2*j}}_ \times _{{2*j}}_=_{{16*j*j*j}}_\)
Now volume of the half cylinder\(=\frac 12 \times[\pi \times r^2\times l]\) diameter of the cylinder=\(\frac l2\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac 12 \times \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times _{{4*j}}_=_{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*j*2,2)}}_\)
volume of the cylinders inside the box\(=2\times [ \pi \times r^2 \times height]\)
height of the cylinders = height of the cuboid= _{{2*j}}_
volume of the cylinders\(= 2\times [ \frac {22}7 \times _{j}_^2 \times _{{2*j}}_]= _{{trunc(2*pi_val*j*j*2*j,2)}}_\)
Now the volume of air inside the box\(= _{{16*j*j*j}}_ + _{{trunc(pi_val*j*j*j*2,2)}}_ - _{{trunc(2*pi_val*j*j*2*j,2)}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{trunc(16*j*j*j+pi_val*j*j*j*2-2*pi_val*j*j*2*j,2)}}_\, cm^3\)

content.text:
A box is in the shape of the cuboid surmounted by a half cylinder.
Two solid gold cylinders are placed closed to each other as shown in the figure.
If the value of L is _{{4*j}}_ cm, find the volume of air inside the box.
